isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - CYLINDER HEAD INSPECTION - CHECK FOR VALVE LEAKAGE (Using Mineral Spirits)

svcproc.title: CHECK FOR VALVE LEAKAGE (Using Mineral Spirits)

step1.para: Visually inspect for valve leakage as follows:

step2.para: Position the cylinder head on wood blocks with the gasket surface facing down.

Squirt mineral spirits into the the intake and exhaust ports as shown in Figure 4.16
.

step1.para: Wait five minutes, use an inspection mirror and visually inspect the valve seat area for leakage of the mineral spirits. Repeat and check all intake and exhaust valves.

important.para: THERE SHOULD BE NO LEAKAGE. RECONDITIONING IS NOT REQUIRED IF THE CYLINDER HEAD PASSES THE MINERAL SPIRITS TEST. IF LEAKAGE IS OBSERVED, THE VALVES REQUIRE RECONDITIONING. REFER TO "CYLINDER HEAD RECONDITIONING" IN THIS SECTION. THIS TEST DOES NOT CHECK FOR CONDITION OF VALVE GUIDE OR VALVE STEM-TO-GUIDE CLEARANCE

svcsubproc.title: INSPECT FOR CRACKS (Using Dye Penetrant Method OEM1272)
svcsubproc.para:
Visually inspect for cylinder head cracks using the four step dye penetrant method as follows: (Refer to Figure 4.17
).

step1.para: STEP ONE - Spray the cleaner onto the lower deck (gasket surface) of the head and wipe dry.
STEP TWO - Spray on the dye penetrant. Allow the dye to remain on the surface from one (1) to ten (10) minutes.
STEP THREE - Wipe the dye off the surface.

note.para: Dye will remain in any cracks during the "wipe off" step.

step1.para: STEP FOUR - Spray on the developer and let dry for five to fifteen minutes.

note.para: Cracks will show up as purple lines against the white developer. Refer to Figure 4.18.

important.para: IF ANY CRACKS ARE PRESENT, REPLACE THE CYLINDER HEAD.
